gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows the general locations of Silurian rock reef bank formations in Indiana. These data include two major reef bank areas, known as the Fort Wayne bank area and the Terre Haute bank area. This shapefile can be used in conjunction with SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN was created to provide a digital shapefile of the locations of Silurian rock reef data in the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from a preexisting published paper map (Ault, C.H., Becker, L.E., Droste, J.B., Keller, S.J., and Shaver, R.H., 1992, Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54). This shapefile can be used in conjunction with SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN.

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 shapefile format, approximately 108 Kb.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The digital shapefile was derived with minor modifications from a preexisting published paper map (Ault and others, 1992) and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published map. SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various types of reef exposures. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived.

SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various types of reef exposures. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived.

No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing this shapefile were derived from a shapefile named LANDSURVEY_STATE_POLY_IN that was created by the Indiana Geological Survey at a source scale of 1:24,000. The following note appears on the published source map (Ault and others, 1992): "Base modified from U.S. Geological Survey Base Map of Indiana; 1950." No quantitative tests were performed.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A paper copy of the map titled "Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54" was scanned using a wide-bed color scanner at the Indiana Geological Survey. The scanned TIFF image was then loaded into ESRI's ArcMap 8.3 and georeferenced using the shapefile named LANDSURVEY_STATE_POLY_IN that was created at a scale of 1:24,000 by the Indiana Geological Survey, to obtain control points in UTM Zone 16, NAD 83 coordinates. The georeferenced image was then used as a backround image at the approximate on-screen zoom scale of 1:356,000. ESRI's ArcCatalog was then used to create an empty shapefile named SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN. SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN was then loaded into ESRI's ArcMap where an edit session was started and all polygons were manually digitized. The shapefile table was then attributed with information obtained from the backround image file. All edits were then saved to the shapefile SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN.SHP was extracted from information contained in IGS MM54.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
